instructions:
# Official Savage Worlds Character Sheet

### version 1.00.31 

## Character Sheet

* This is the Official Savage Worlds Character Sheet.
* Supports Wild Cards and Extras
* Dice rolling
* various setting rules

## Custom Configuration

To configure the sheet to meet your needs, click the crossed hammer and wrench.

## Skills

* All skills from the SWADE rules are available, with the ability to change their names. To pick your skills, click the crossed hammer and wrench next to the Skills heading and place a check mark next to each skill you'd like to use.
* If you need to make a skill an Unskilled roll, you can either use the Unskilled "skill" OR place a -2 in the skill modifier field.

## Additional Notes

* More info about individual sections can be found in the Documentation wiki.
* If there's something you want added, or you'd like to report a bug, feel free to join the Official Savage Worlds Character Sheet Game (https://app.roll20.net/join/8109876/l20ASw). That game has forums for Bug Reports and Enhancement Requests.

useroptions.description: Set the default icon to designate a Wild Card. Will accept most unicode characters (including emojis--though these may make it difficult to tell a Wild Card from an Extra, because they don't gray out).
This option sets new characters to default as Extras, instead of Wild Cards.

Selecting a sheet theme will set the background image, logo displayed, and any special styling associated with the theme. The theme options are: Generic (the default), Deadlands (an Old West styled theme), Pathfinder (a theme to match the Pathfinder for Savage Worlds books), and Rifts® (a more sci-fi type of theme). Even if a theme is selected, you can still change the packground or logo if desired.

Select a theme for the roll template. The theme options are: Generic (the default), Deadlands (an Old West styled theme), Pathfinder (a theme to match the Pathfinder for Savage Worlds books), and Rifts® (a more sci-fi type theme).
Selecting this option will show the Token (or Avatar) associated with the character sheet. If neither a token nor an avatar are assigned to the character, this option will automatically deselect.
Select a logo a to display on the character sheet. If you select Custom, use the field below (Logo URL) to indicate the url where the logo image is located.
URL to the (custom) logo image you want to use on your character.
Select a background image for the character sheet. If you select Custom, use the field below (Custom Background URL) to indicate the url where the background image is located.
URL to the (custom) background image you want to use on your character sheet.
